body.p: The amendments made in 2011 updated the disclosure requirements, because of concerns:

li.p: that the disclosures required by the previous version of IAS 19 did not enable users of financial statements to understand the financial effect of liabilities and assets arising from defined benefit plans on the financial statements as a whole.

that the volume of disclosures about defined benefit plans in many financial statements risked reducing understandability and usefulness by obscuring important information. This concern was particularly pronounced for multinational entities that have many varied plans in many jurisdictions.
